data.title: 25 Sensational Games Like Hogwarts Legacy in 2024
data.meta_description: Open-world Hogwarts RPG games like Hogwarts Legacy include Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery, Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, Dragon Age: Inquisition, Final Fantasy XV, Zelda: Breath of the Wild and more!
data.text:
Should Hogwarts Legacy capture your attention, numerous comparable games stand ready to further enchant you.

Hogwarts Legacy is an immersive, open-world, action role-playing game set in the world first introduced in the Harry Potter books. Now you can take control of your destiny in a brand new wizarding world adventure that puts you at the center of your own story. The game is set in the 1800s, which means you'll explore Hogwarts and its surrounding areas in a time before Harry and friends ever set foot there. As a student, you can choose your house, attend classes, build relationships, and of course, master powerful magic. The more you play, the more you'll notice this isn't just a fresh coat of paint on a familiar location - it's an entirely new narrative within a beloved and richly constructed universe.

If you're a fan of role-playing games and the Wizarding World, you'll likely find similar enjoyment in other titles. Games like the Witcher series, where you'll also venture into an extensive world filled with magic, intrigue, and complex characters. Or maybe you'd delight in something like the towering landscapes and immersive lore of the Elder Scrolls series. Perhaps titles with emphasis on choice and morality that affects the narrative, like in the Mass Effect series, would capture your attention. These games, among many others, could offer you a range of experiences as nuanced and engaging as Hogwarts Legacy promises to be. But wait, there's actually a more comprehensive list of recommendations, carefully tailored to align closely with...

Note: I may earn a commission from purchases through links in this article, but the price is the same.

25. Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery

If you're a fan of Hogwarts Legacy, you'll find a lot to love in Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery. Just like Hogwarts Legacy, Hogwarts Mystery invites you on a thrilling journey through the enchanted halls of Hogwarts. You can cast spells, brew potions, and forge friendships or rivalries just as you would in Legacy, but here's the kicker: You're the one choosing how your magical adventure unfolds! You have the freedom to choose your own house, select your friends, and even decide how you want to respond in critical situations, adding an exciting element of personal strategy and decision-making that mirrors the choices you make in Legacy.

What sets Hogwarts Mystery apart and yet keeps it on the same magical wavelength as Hogwarts Legacy is the time setting. Unlike Hogwarts Legacy which is set in the 17th century, Hogwarts Mystery takes place right after Harry Potter's birth, meaning you get an enriching variety of character interactions with younger versions of characters you've been familiar with in Legacy, making for an exhilarating twist. This setting shift allows for unique story-telling possibilities which give depth and new perspectives to the cherished Wizarding World we have come to love in both games.

Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery is available on iOS and Android devices, typically priced around $0 USD as it's a free-to-play game with optional in-app purchases.

Main Site

24. Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix game shares a lot of similarities with Hogwarts Legacy in that they both represent the enchanting world of Hogwarts in an interactive experience. You get to roam around Hogwarts, interact with the characters, participate in lessons, and even play Quidditch, which should definitely pique your interest if you liked the open-world aspect of Hogwarts Legacy. Both games also lean heavily into the role-playing aspect where you get to be a student at Hogwarts, completing daily tasks, brewing potions, learning spells and charms and solving mysteries, just like in Hogwarts Legacy.

The aspect of storytelling is also shared between the two games. In Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, you play through the events of the fifth book, which is an exceptional experience, especially for those who admire J.K. Rowling's storytelling. On the other hand, in Hogwarts Legacy you explore an original narrative set in the 1800s which still holds the same Hogwarts charm. You'll come across elements that tie back to the Harry Potter series, just like how Hogwarts Legacy integrated items and spells from the original books, making it a treat for any Harry Potter fan.

Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix is available on PlayStation 2, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, Wii, PC, and PSP, typically priced around $20 USD.

$23 from Amazon

23. Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Hogwarts Legacy and Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince share a compelling, familiar world brimming with magic, mystery, and adventure — the extraordinary universe of J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter. Much like Hogwarts Legacy, Half-Blood Prince greatly emphasizes exploration throughout Hogwarts. This provides a fan-pleasing dive into the deeper, previously unseen corners of the wizarding school. The game is not strictly linear, as side quests and optional activities like potion brewing, Quidditch, and dueling add layers of depth to the gameplay. You very much forge your own path through these activities, similar to the free-roaming experience of Hogwarts Legacy.

The strong narrative thread in the Half-Blood Prince will appeal to you if you enjoyed the engaging story-driven aspects of Hogwarts Legacy. The game follows the story of the sixth book and film closely, with thrilling puzzles and battles intertwined with the unfolding plot. One key point that sets it apart is the inclusion of iconic characters from the series, allowing you to interact with beloved figures like Dumbledore and Snape, recreating a narrative experience that is on par with Hogwarts Legacy's immersive storytelling.

Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is available on PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, Nintendo Wii, and PC, typically priced around $20 USD.

$23 from Amazon

22. Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1

So, I can draw many similarities between Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 1 and Hogwarts Legacy. The Deathly Hallows game, much like Legacy, allows you to experience the magical world of Hogwarts, giving you the feeling of being part of a grand, adventurous narrative just like the film. Both games successfully capture that immersive, magical universe, with a rich story and fleshed-out characters that we all know and love from the Harry Potter franchise. Deathly Hallows - Part 1 lets you step into Harry's shoes and experience first-hand the thrilling story as you venture to defeat Voldemort, which is not dissimilar to the epic journey you undertook in Hogwarts Legacy.

The gameplay of Deathly Hallows - Part 1 is pretty unique in its style, but if you liked the spellcasting and exploration aspect of Hogwarts Legacy, you'll truly appreciate the mechanics in this game. In Deathly Hallows - Part 1, as Harry, you'll have a variety of spells at your disposal - much like in Legacy; you will also explore dynamic environments and engage in battles with Death Eaters and Snatchers. The attention to detail in the game's visual representation of these fantastical locations, creatures and magic, paired with its immersive storyline, is remarkably similar to what you experienced in Hogwarts Legacy, hence making the transition between games quite smooth.

Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1 is available on PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, Wii, Nintendo DS, and Microsoft Windows, typically priced around $20 USD.

$44 from Amazon

21. Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2

Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2 is incredibly similar to Hogwarts Legacy, offering a familiar and deeply immersive experience. Just as in the Hogwarts Legacy game where the story progresses based on your choices and actions, in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2, you get the chance to shape the narrative, encountering familiar faces and exploring well-known locations. You also get to participate in epic battles, solve riddles and embark on thrilling quests, just like how Hogwarts Legacy captivated you with its engaging gameplay elements.

Besides, a shared sense of magical immersion is evident in both games. If you thoroughly enjoyed the spell-casting element in Hogwarts Legacy, you'd feel at home with Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2. You can execute plenty of spells against foes, defend against attacks, and cast magic in different circumstances, which are reminiscent of the exciting duels and magical workings in Hogwarts Legacy. Thus, this game might exactly be your next favourite, allowing you to revisit Hogwarts and experience magic through Harry Potter’s eyes.

Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2 is available on PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, Nintendo Wii, and Windows PC, typically priced around $30 USD.

$48 from Amazon

20. The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Related article: 25 Amazing Games Like The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt in 2024!

One parallel that immediately springs to mind is the expansive, deeply immersive worlds both games offer. Much like Hogwarts Legacy, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt presents an enormous and interactive open-world setting that is waiting to be discovered. You will find yourself in lush forests, grimy swamps, bustling cities, mountainous regions, and ancient ruins. Various activities are scattered throughout this world, from hunting down mythical beasts to playing a seemingly innocuous card game, all contributing to the overall sense of deep immersion.

Another exciting similar aspect between the two games lies in the rich storyline and character development. Like Hogwarts Legacy, The Witcher 3 thrives on its narrative depth. It boasts intricate storylines that unravel as you make choices throughout the gameplay, each decision influencing subsequent events and ultimately shaping the game's outcome. Interesting and diverse characters, each with their unique background and motivations, become key elements of the narrative, progressively unveiling their depth as the plot advances. This echoes the diverse array of individuals and their unique stories you encountered while navigating Hogwarts Legacy.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is available on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X and Series S, and PC, typically priced around $39.99 USD.

$25 from Amazon

19. The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

Both The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim and Hogwarts Legacy offer a brilliant, immersive world filled with magical experiences and endless opportunities. Particularly, Skyrim summons a similar sense of exploration and discovery that would have attracted you to Hogwarts Legacy. Walking through the wintry landscapes of Skyrim, you will find ancient ruins and mysterious dungeons just waiting to be explored, very much like uncovering the secrets of Hogwarts castle. Magic plays a significant role, and you will derive a similar sense of gratification as you learn and master new spells, no less exciting than wielding a wand at Hogwarts.

Moreover, the character progression in Skyrim might remind you of the growth of your student character in Hogwarts Legacy. Though Skyrim doesn't exactly foray into structured classes like magic lessons at Hogwarts, the free-form advancement system allows character abilities to improve through use. That means casting spells and successfully sneaking around will gradually make you better at those activities. Not to mention, Skyrim also offers a myriad of quests and side missions that involve solving puzzles, negotiating with NPCs and often moral choices - much like the challenges you faced in Hogwarts Legacy. The main storyline of Skyrim is brilliantly written with plot twists and recurring characters, and the game's emphasis on player freedom will make you feel a level of agency similar to what Hogwarts Legacy allowed.

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim is available on Playstation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch and PC, typically priced around $40 USD.

$53 from Amazon

18. Dragon Age: Inquisition

Dragon Age: Inquisition is quite akin to Hogwarts Legacy in many ways. At its core, Dragon Age: Inquisition is an action/adventure RPG much like Hogwarts Legacy, with a well-crafted world that abounds with detailed characters, gripping quests, and nuanced combat systems. Both games possess rich narratives with immersive choice-driven elements that allow you to craft your own character's story. They also embrace the inclusion of magical abilities and beings, adding a fantastic element that keeps players enthralled.

Another common thread between Dragon Age: Inquisition and Hogwarts Legacy is the freedom to explore massive, in-depth universes. The pulsating, richly-detailed landscapes in both games offer plenty to explore and discover: secret locations, hidden treasures, diverse NPCs, and well-integrated side missions that enrich the main story. Furthermore, the lore in both these franchises is vast and intricate, making their universes feel genuinely lived-in and tangible, with events, locations, and history that weave a rich tapestry beyond the main narrative. Collaboration and interaction with other characters, friends and foes alike, are strongly encouraged and governed by strategic and tactical possibilities, strengthening the resemblance between the two titles.

Dragon Age: Inquisition is available on PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $20 USD.

$10 from Amazon

17. Final Fantasy XV

Related article: 25 Awesome Games Like Final Fantasy XV in 2024!

Firstly, both Final Fantasy XV and Hogwarts Legacy offer an expansive open-world environment for exploration. In Final Fantasy XV, you'll be traversing through the kingdom of Lucis, rich in ecosystems, wildlife, and landscapes - striking a very strong resemblance to the richly detailed world of Hogwarts Legacy. The open-world nature of these games provides endless excitement and there's always something new to discover. If you loved navigating through the vast world of Hogwarts, you will certainly be entranced by the breathtaking landscapes of Eos in Final Fantasy XV.

Secondly, the storyline and the character interactions are very similar in both games. If you enjoyed the camaraderie between the characters in Hogwarts Legacy, you will find a similar energy in Final Fantasy XV. The tight-knit group of lead characters, their banter, the feeling of friendship, and the emotional depth are all there. Just like Hogwarts Legacy, Final Fantasy XV also implements system-based magical abilities that allows a unique blend of magic into the combat system, giving you endless possibilities of combinations and strategies similar to casting different spells in Hogwarts Legacy.

Final Fantasy XV is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PCs, typically priced around $20 USD.

$23 from Amazon

16. Breath of the Wild

Related article: 25 Remarkable Games Like Breath of the Wild in 2024

At the core, both Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Hogwarts Legacy thrive on the spirit of exploration and discovery. In Breath of the Wild, much like in Hogwarts Legacy, you are tasked with mapping out a massive, lush, and exquisitely detailed open world teeming with secrets. Enigmatic puzzles to solve, numerous creatures to encounter, and a myriad of side quests to undertake – it's easy to get lost for hours in the magical charm that both games offer. On top of this, the sense of freedom and player agency they both provide is a major highlight. You are not tied down to a linear path and can approach the game in your own unique way, creating your own narratives.

Furthermore, the combat mechanics in Zelda: Breath of the Wild might strike a chord with Hogwarts Legacy fans as well. Though not entirely identical, both games offer a strategic, fluid, and engaging combat style that demands a good mixture of strategy and skill. Experimenting with different spells in Hogwarts Legacy could bring back memories of how you could mix and match weapons, abilities, and environmental elements in Breath of the Wild to defeat enemies. The enchanting art style and whimsical themes of the visuals and narrative in both games further deepen the similarities.

Zelda: Breath of the Wild is available on the Nintendo Switch, typically priced around $60 USD.

15. Fable III

In Fable III, like in Hogwarts Legacy, you find a captivating, open-world environment where your decisions reshape the world around you. Similar to Hogwarts Legacy, Fable III gives you a high level of control over your gameplay experience. You can shape your character's attributes, build relationships, interact with non-playable characters, and even alter the political and social scenario of your land. This interactivity echoes Hogwarts Legacy, where you mold your Wizarding World persona, influence the globe and make decisions that ripple throughout the game.

A major feature of both games is the captivating narratives that are primarily player-driven. In Fable III, you are the hero fighting against tyranny, analogous to your role in Hogwarts Legacy, where you uncover ancient secrets that could alter wizarding history. The player’s story is the one that unfolds. Much like Hogwarts Legacy, Fable III encourages personal growth, with the character evolving based on moral decisions you make during gameplay. Opposing actions lead to different outcomes, meaning your choices determine the fate of your character, quite similar to how your conduct shapes your journey at Hogwarts.

Fable III is available on Xbox 360, Xbox One through backward compatibility, Xbox Series X/S and Microsoft Windows, typically priced around $20 USD.

$20 from Amazon

14. Shadow of Mordor

Shadow of Mordor shares several engaging features with Hogwarts Legacy, making it a great game to consider if you're looking for similar experiences. Both games are established in rich, popular fantasy worlds taken from significant book series, Tolkien's Middle-earth and J.K. Rowling's Wizarding World. Just like going around the Hogwarts castle and the adjacent magical areas, Middle-earth on Shadow of Mordor offers a vast, open-world environment to explore filled with iconic locations, interactive NPCs, and a multitude of quests. Furthermore, these titles both encourage players to strategize and learn new skills as gameplay progresses, enhancing the immersive aspect of inhabiting a distinctive, magical world.

The combat systems are also similar in a way that they feature spectacular battles filled with magic, although Shadow of Mordor leans more on melee-oriented fights. With the battles against Orcs in Mordor, you may find an equivalent level of challenge as to the dramatic duels you enjoyed in Hogwarts Legacy. The Nemesis System in Shadow of Mordor, which makes every enemy unique and personalizes your confrontations, can possibly remind you of your interactions with different nemeses in Hogwarts Legacy. And like Hogwarts Legacy, Shadow of Mordor also focuses heavily on story and character development, so while it might be a grittier tale, it's just as gripping.

Shadow of Mordor is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $20 USD.

$25 from Amazon

13. Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen

Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen and Hogwarts Legacy share similarities in their narrative-driven, role-playing approach to gaming. Both games offer an immersive world teeming with rich lore and compelling characters. In Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen, you also get to interact with and form relationships with your allies, much like you would at Hogwarts in the Legacy game. Just like in Hogwarts Legacy, your decisions shape the world and the characters around you, adding a layer of depth to the gameplay and inviting repeated playthroughs.

The games both also offer a great sense of freedom when it comes to exploration. In Hogwarts Legacy, you get to explore iconic locations within the wizarding world, and Dragon's Dogma provides a similar, expansive open-world experience. It's filled with countless foes, mythical creatures, perilous dungeons, and hidden treasures, drawing parallels to the magical and exciting experiences you encounter in Hogwarts Legacy. The dark fantasy environment of Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen is sure to appeal to Hogwarts Legacy fans seeking a new world to explore and conquer.

Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and PC, typically priced around $30 USD.

$29 from Amazon

12. Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning

One of the striking similarities between Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning and Hogwarts Legacy is the rich, detailed, and immersive open-world structure they both share. Just like Hogwarts Legacy, Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning provides an expansive world designed and detailed to perfection. Such environments are filled with magical elements, interesting non-playable characters (NPCs), and numerous side quests that aren't merely repetitive tasks but intricate stories that help in building the lore of the world. Both games also offer an impressive amount of customization, allowing you to shape your playable character, expand on your abilities, and make impactful choices thus fostering a deep connection with the world and its characters.

Another common aspect is the emphasis on a strong narrative, stimulated by player choices. In the same way Hogwarts Legacy allows you to carve your own path and narrative, Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning also encourages taking reins of your own destiny. The game goes strong on narrative, involving profound role-playing elements where your actions and decisions shape the outcome of your story. Your interactions with NPCs aren't just for service but they build your character's path and progression. Moreover, both games provide combat diversity allowing players to experiment with various combat styles and strategies making every combat encounter unique and thrilling.

Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $40 USD.

$34 from Amazon

11. Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings

If you're looking for a game that mirrors some of the elements of Hogwarts Legacy, then Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings might just be your cup of tea. Like the magical universe of Hogwarts, you delve into a richly developed world filled with mythical creatures, sentient beings, and an extensive library of lore and mythical history. The storytelling in Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings is spectacular, with a mature narrative that includes deep, intricate relationships much like those between Hogwarts occupants. This game actively rewards exploration and cleverly weaves a multitude of engaging side quests throughout the story, creating a livelier role-playing experience.

The role-playing component of Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings also bears similarities to Hogwarts Legacy. You play as Geralt of Rivia, a Witcher, who is a beast slayer possessed of supernatural abilities. You are free to mold Geralt’s personality to your liking, similar to your character development in Hogwarts Legacy. Witcher 2 has a dynamic dialogue system that influences relationships and events within the game, reminiscent of the choices affecting your House and friend circle in Hogwarts Legacy. Lastly, the magic element in the Witcher universe adds a layer of similarity. Geralt, much like your character at Hogwarts, can use various signs for combat and tactical advantage. Also, alchemy plays a significant role in Geralt’s journey, not unlike the importance of potions in Hogwarts Legacy.

Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings is available on PC, Xbox 360, and Xbox One, typically priced around $20 USD.

$35 from Amazon

10. Monster Hunter: World

Related article: 25 Impressive Games Like Monster Hunter: World in 2024!

Monster Hunter: World shares quite a few similarities with Hogwarts Legacy, chiefly in the immersive, fantastical worlds they both offer. Much like Hogwarts Legacy let you explore the magical Harry Potter Universe, Monster Hunter: World provides a unique opportunity to step into a richly detailed and expansive environment filled with diverse monsters and breathtaking landscapes. There's a comparable sense of awe and discovery as you delve into the various ecosystems and uncover new beasts, equatable to your quest for magical secrets in the corridors of Hogwarts.

Similarly to Hogwarts Legacy, Monster Hunter: World gives high emphasis to RPG elements. It features vast character personalization options, allowing you to create a unique avatar that fits your battle style, from choosing your armor and palico companion to upgrading your weapon. Also, at the center of both games lays a compelling narrative; for Monster Hunter, it's your mission as a hunter to track, trap, and annihilate various creatures, just like your journey as a student navigating the magical world of Hogwarts.

Monster Hunter: World is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $30 USD.

$27 from Amazon

9. Neverwinter Nights 2

In many ways, Neverwinter Nights 2 could be likened to Hogwarts Legacy due to its immersive and dynamic gameplay steeped in a richly detailed fantasy universe. Like in Hogwarts Legacy where you are exposed to an expansive wizarding world filled with enchantment, Neverwinter Nights 2 also transports you into a deeply engaging Dungeons-and-Dragons-based world filled with magic, monsters, and mystery. This game provides you with a prodigious opportunity to interact with various characters, solve intriguing puzzles, and cast powerful spells in one-on-one combat or group fights. These elements mimic the thrill of the unforgettable adventures and tasks you undertook as a member of the Hogwarts School in Hogwarts Legacy leading to hours of exciting gameplay and unique experiences.

Moreover, both games boast impressive emphasis on character progression and choice-based narratives where your choices significantly impact the storyline. In Hogwarts Legacy, your character's actions not only determine your relationship with other students and faculty but also the outcome of the main story. Similarly, Neverwinter Nights 2's character development system and—more notably—the influence system, allow you to shape not just your own character's abilities and specialties, but also the relationships with your party members and how they evolve during the story, thereby creating a deeply layered and individualized storyline much like in Hogwarts Legacy.

Neverwinter Nights 2 is available on PC platforms such as Steam, typically priced around $10 USD.

$28 from G2A

8. Pillars of Eternity

Both Pillars of Eternity and Hogwarts Legacy share a deep cinematic narration and superb fantasy worldbuilding, drawing the player into immersive worlds filled with lore and secrets. Pillars of Eternity, like Hogwarts Legacy, features a detailed character creation system with several races, classes, and backgrounds to choose from. Similarly to your experience with Hogwarts Legacy, in Pillars of Eternity, your choices matter. The decisions made throughout the game influence the world, characters, and even the outcome of the story, providing you with that same sense of agency and consequence that fans loved in Hogwarts Legacy.

On top of the rich storytelling aspect, both games also share strategic, challenging combat systems. Hogwarts Legacy focuses on magic-based battles, while Pillars of Eternity uses real-time combat with a pause function that enables strategic planning in battles, much like setting up spells in Hogwarts Legacy. Both games ensure that each encounter is tactical and thoughtful. Plus, there's additional depth in Pillars of Eternity through its companion system. As with Hogwarts Legacy's team-based strategies, Pillars of Eternity encourages you to customize your party, each member contributing their unique skills and abilities to the team, amplifying that element of strategy and complexity in combat.

Pillars of Eternity is available on macOS, Windows, Linux, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One, typically priced around $30 USD.

$20 from Amazon

7. Dark Souls III

Both Dark Souls III and Hogwarts Legacy are games that offer richly detailed and immersive worlds, full of atmospheric locations to explore and secrets to uncover. Just like in Hogwarts Legacy where every corner of the Hogwarts school and its surroundings is filled with mysteries and magic, Dark Souls III presents its medieval fantasy world in a way that requires careful exploration and encourages discovery. The lore and the backstory in these games are not directly served to the player; rather, they have to be pieced together from environmental cues and obscure item descriptions, which can be a rewarding experience for those who love to engage with the game world on a deeper level.

Moreover, both games emphasize the importance of developing your character and learning new skills. In Hogwarts Legacy, you seek to improve your magical abilities and brew various potions to take down foes and solve puzzles. Similarly, Dark Souls III offers a complex and rewarding combat system where you can tailor your character according to your playstyle. You can choose from a wide array of weapons, spells, and equipment, and develop your skills as you toughen your way through hordes of intimidating adversaries. The progression in these games feels satisfying and exciting, as every new ability or skill you acquire can significantly influence the way you face challenges, adding more layers of strategy and depth to the gameplay.

Dark Souls III is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PCs, typically priced around $60 USD.

$23 from Amazon

6. Fallout 4

Related article: 25 Fantastic Games Like Fallout 4 in 2024

Well, if you enjoyed Hogwarts Legacy, I'd definitely suggest considering Fallout 4. The key similarity between the two is the element of choice. Like Hogwarts Legacy, Fallout 4 encourages you to shape your own outcomes throughout the game. You can make meaningful decisions that affect your relationships with other characters and shape your journey within the game world. You are given the freedom to explore a massive open world at your own pace and the decisions you make significantly influence the storyline and your individual experience. It's not about learning spells, but it's about adapting and surviving in a post-nuclear apocalyptic world.

Character customisation and interpersonal relationships play a huge role in both games as well. You can really dive into creating a character that reflects your chosen playstyle in Fallout 4, very similar to how you could characterise yourself in Hogwarts Legacy. The dialogue options then shape your interactions with other characters and impact their view of you, leading to different plot outcomes. There's also a skill tree system in Fallout 4 akin to the spell learning system in Hogwarts, helping create different specialisations and variety in gameplay. So, even if you're swapping wands for weapons, the core mechanics have fantastic parallels worth exploring.

Fallout 4 is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and on Windows via Steam, typically priced around $30 USD.

$22 from Amazon

5. Assassin's Creed Odyssey

Related article: 25 Awesome Games Like Assassin\'s Creed Odyssey in 2024!

In many ways, Assassin's Creed Odyssey is akin to Hogwarts Legacy, particularly when it comes to the open-world setting, the diverse array of missions, quests, and the intricate storylines. Both games shine in their world-building aspect, providing an expansive and immersive environment for the players. Odyssey's Ancient Greece offers the same depth of exploration, with its historical cities, grand temples, and azure Aegean Sea now being a vast playground for your character's exploits. Not unlike the Wizarding World, the Greco-Roman mythologies effortlessly blend with the game's original narrative, so you often don't know where history ends and the fiction starts. The captivating main storyline is interwoven with meaningful side quests, a feature you loved so much in Hogwarts Legacy.

Similarly to Hogwarts Legacy, character choice and progression are central to the Assassin's Creed Odyssey gameplay experience. The game allows you to choose between two protagonists from the start, each with a unique perspective and responses tailored in the dialogue decisions. Like the magic and potion crafting, the skill tree in Odyssey gives you the flexibility to turn your character into a bow assassin, a Spartan warrior, or a stealthy stalker, depending upon how you wish to deal with your adversaries. The RPG element will remind you of your experiences in Hogwarts Legacy, where your decisions significantly influenced the game's unfolding.

Assassin's Creed Odyssey is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and PC, typically priced around $59.99 USD.

$29 from Amazon

4. Baldur's Gate 3

Related article: 25 Magnificent Games Like Baldur's Gate 3 in 2024

Baldur's Gate 3, like Hogwarts Legacy, is developed with a strong emphasis on narrative-driven role-playing. As in Hogwarts Legacy, choices you make in Baldur's Gate 3 significantly influence the story and affect your character's relationships, aligning it perfectly with the interactive dialogues and morally significant actions you loved in Hogwarts Legacy. Additionally, the fantasy settings share a similar feel; whether you're wading through gothic dungeons or diverse landscapes, the games deliver an immersive experience that truly transports you to another world.

Combat is another exciting similarity Baldur's Gate 3 shares with Hogwarts Legacy. Baldur’s Gate 3 also features a tactical, turn-based combat system like Hogwarts Legacy does. Leveraging the strengths of your party members, learning new spells, and adapting your strategy to a variety of enemies and situations are key to success in this game. Each battle presents its own unique challenges and brings an element of unpredictability, just as Hogwarts Legacy did. Additionally, the magic spells and abilities in Baldur’s Gate 3 are sure to remind you of the spellcasting you enjoyed in Hogwarts Legacy.

Baldur's Gate 3 is available on the Microsoft Windows, Stadia and Mac OS platforms, typically priced around $60 USD.

$24 from G2A

3. World of Warcraft

Related article: 25 Breathtaking Games Like World of Warcraft in 2024

In the spectrum of immersive, fantasy-based open-world games, the popular MMORPG World of Warcraft shares some key similarities with Hogwarts Legacy. Both allow you to fully immerse yourself in their respective universes. For those who loved the freedom of exploring every corner of Hogwarts castle, World of Warcraft offers a variety of expansive landscapes, ranging from lush forests, arctic wastelands, alien landscapes, and ancient kingdoms. Just like in Hogwarts Legacy, exploration is a key aspect of these games, offering a plethora of secrets to discover, quests to embark on, and multiple engaging storylines to follow.

Character character creation and development is another shared strength of these games. Much like in Hogwarts Legacy, World of Warcraft lets you customize your own character's appearance, choose their abilities, and determine their progression. Strategies, tactics, and choices made during gameplay will affect how your character evolves and what abilities they gain access to - making every game-playing experience unique. The community aspect of World of Warcraft also mirrors the interactions you would have with NPCs in Hogwarts Legacy, as you cooperate and compete with thousands of other players worldwide, forming alliances and making enemies much like you would in the halls of Hogwarts.

World of Warcraft is available on Microsoft Windows and MacOS platforms, typically priced around $15 USD monthly for the subscription.

Main Site

2. Mass Effect: Andromeda

Mass Effect: Andromeda has similar RPG and exploration elements to Hogwarts Legacy. Just like in Hogwarts Legacy, you dive into an expansive world with a rich history and diverse characters, the Andromeda galaxy gives you a whole new universe to explore in your journey to find a new home for humanity. As Ryder, you get to interact with multiple species, build alliances, and make decisions that will shape the course of your story - a familiar trope if you're coming from the choices you had to make at Hogwarts. Furthermore, just like the magic system in Hogwarts Legacy, Andromeda has an excellent combat system that invites experimentation and adaptation, with each choice in your skills allowing you to approach battles differently.

The narrative depth and character development are other areas where Mass Effect: Andromeda mirrors Hogwarts Legacy. The game is packed with rich dialogues and narratives that unfold based on your decisions and actions. This gives you a sense of control over the story's course, much like the paths you chose in Hogwarts Legacy. Every action and decision you make in Mass Effect: Andromeda have consequences, providing you with that immersive RPG experience. Moreover, Andromeda also offers the ability to build relationships with companions, much like the friendships or rivalries you may have fostered at Hogwarts. As Ryder, you get to form bonds with your crew that can even bloom into romances, further deepening the role-playing aspect of the game.

Mass Effect: Andromeda is available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, typically priced around $20 USD.
